verses.plain: When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without.

tokens.t: When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in,
the troop of robbers spoileth without.

verses.plain: And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.

tokens.t: And they consider not in their hearts
I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.

verses.plain: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

tokens.t: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

verses.plain: They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.

tokens.t: They
all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker,
ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.

verses.plain: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.

tokens.t: In the day of our king the princes have made
sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.

verses.plain: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.

tokens.t: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.

verses.plain: They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.

tokens.t: They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen:
none among them that calleth unto me.

verses.plain: Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

tokens.t: Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

verses.plain: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.

tokens.t: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth
not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.

verses.plain: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the LORD their God, nor seek him for all this.

tokens.t: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the
their God, nor seek him for all this.

verses.plain: ¶ Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.

tokens.t: ¶ Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.

verses.plain: When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.

tokens.t: When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.

verses.plain: Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.

tokens.t: Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.

verses.plain: And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, and they rebel against me.

tokens.t: And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine,
they rebel against me.

verses.plain: Though I have bound and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.

tokens.t: Though I have bound
strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.

verses.plain: They return, but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.

tokens.t: They return,
not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this
their derision in the land of Egypt.

footnotes.text: who…: or, the raiser will cease
